result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Anne Fitzpatrick

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Nicole Anne Fitzpatrick appeared by phone.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by phone for Nicole Anne Fitzpatrick.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Received complaint, waived reading, advised of rights, NG plea entered. Parties will Pre try the case on their own, 950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Saint Pierre is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100.00 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 12/1/22.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
Copy mailed to DE on 10/18.  cjs

8:36 AM Defendant Nicole Anne Fitzpatrick in court.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Deft states she filed Court Appointed Paperwork with the Clerk of Court's Office last week Friday.
Deft does not qualify for Public Defender.
Court will review and have Judicial Assistant appoint an Attorney as soon as paperwork is received.
Court reschedules to next Monday.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property.

Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
No contact or possession of any animals.
